meanings.definition: A pedal in a vehicle that controls the speed of the engine.
meanings.sent1: Pressing the accelerator makes the car go faster.
meanings.sent2: The driver gently pressed the accelerator to increase speed.
meanings.sent3: The accelerator seemed to have a mind of its own, pushing the car forward unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an accelerator, propelling the joy in the room to new heights.
meanings.sent5: The accelerator was like a magic wand, granting the car the power to zoom ahead.

meanings.definition: A device that increases the speed of a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: Adding the accelerator to the mixture made the reaction happen faster.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use accelerators to speed up chemical processes in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The accelerator in the experiment worked so well, it almost seemed like magic.
meanings.sent4: The accelerator acted like a catalyst, turbocharging the reaction to completion.
meanings.sent5: With the accelerator, the chemical reaction raced ahead at an incredible pace.

meanings.definition: A device that increases the speed of a computer program.
meanings.sent1: The new accelerator improved the performance of the computer program.
meanings.sent2: Tech enthusiasts often seek accelerators to boost their software's speed.
meanings.sent3: The accelerator in the computer was like a secret weapon, making everything lightning fast.
meanings.sent4: Her coding skills were the true accelerator behind the success of the program.
meanings.sent5: With the accelerator, the computer program ran smoother and quicker than ever before.

meanings.definition: A substance that speeds up a physical or chemical process.
meanings.sent1: The accelerator was added to the mixture to hasten the process.
meanings.sent2: The accelerator was a key ingredient in making the reaction occur rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The accelerator in the experiment was like a cheetah, racing the reaction to the finish line.
meanings.sent4: Time was the true accelerator, pushing the process forward relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The accelerator was like a turbo boost, propelling the process to completion in no time.
